protocol_name: PCR partial Control Region Chaetophractus 456 bp
protocol_name_html: PCR partial Control Region Chaetophractus 456 bp
description: We report a phylogeographic study of Chaetophractus villosus populations in Argentina. Control Region (CR) sequences (484 bp) were obtained for 76 C. villosus from 20 locations across the species whole distribution range. Seventeen new haplotypes were identified. The highest genetic variation and the earliest fossils were found in the Pampean Region, thus appearing as the most probable area of origin of the species. A general pattern of Contiguous Range Expansion (CRE) was revealed by Nested Clade Analysis (NCA) supported by mismatch analysis and Fu’s test. The Pampean Region would have been the preexpansion area, while Patagonia would have been the main dispersal route of contiguous expansion, possibly after the Pleistocenic glaciations.
protocol_affiliation: CADIC-CONICET Molecular Ecology Lab., Bernardo Houssay 200 Ushuaia, Argentina
manuscript_citation:
Phylogeography of screaming hairy armadillo Chaetophractus vellerosus: successive disjunctions and extinctions due to cyclical climatic changes in southern South America.

Poljak S,  Alejandro M. Ferreiro2, Marina B. Chiappero2, Julieta Sánchez1,3, Magalí Gabrielli4 and Marta S. Lizarralde1,4.
keywords: Chaetophractus vellerosus, cyclical climatic changes, disjunct distribution, phylogeography, screaming hairy armadillo, southern South America.

authors_list.name: Sebastian Poljak
authors_list.affiliation: CADIC-CONICET Molecular Ecology Lab., Bernardo Houssay 200 Ushuaia, Argentina

guidelines: Partial sequences of mtDNA Control Region (CR) are amplified using the universal primers Thr-L15926 (5´-CAATTCCCCGGTCTTGTAAACC-3´), located in the neighboring tRNA-pro gene and DL-H16340 (5´-CCTGAAGTAGGAACCAGATG-3´) (Vilá el al. 1999).

components.data: Perform the amplification of the double-stranded product in 25 ul volume of PCR mix containing 1.25 U of Taq DNA polymerase, 2.5 ul of 10 x Taq polymerase buffer, 3 mM of MgCl2, 0,16 mM of dNTP´s and 5 pmol of each primer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the amplification of the double-stranded product in 25 ul volume of PCR mix containing 1.25 U of Taq DNA polymerase, 2.5 ul of 10 x Taq polymerase buffer, 3 mM of MgCl2, 0,16 mM of dNTP´s and 5 pmol of each primer.

components.data: Extract DNA from fixed or dried tissues (liver, spleen, muscle and skin) using the sodium dodecyl sulphate–proteinase K/phenol/RNAse method (Sambrock et al., 1989), while extracting DNA from blood following John et al. (1991).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract DNA from fixed or dried tissues (liver, spleen, muscle and skin) using the sodium dodecyl sulphate–proteinase K/phenol/RNAse method (Sambrock et al., 1989), while extracting DNA from blood following John et al. (1991).

components.data: Perform the amplification in a Biometra T Personal thermocycler. With the thermal profile consisting of an initial denaturation at 94 ºC for 5 min, followed by 35 cycles of 94 ºC for 30 s, 56 ºC for 30 s and 72 ºC for 45 s with a final extension step of 72ºC for 8 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform the amplification in a Biometra T Personal thermocycler. With the thermal profile consisting of an initial denaturation at 94 ºC for 5 min, followed by 35 cycles of 94 ºC for 30 s, 56 ºC for 30 s and 72 ºC for 45 s with a final extension step of 72ºC for 8 min.

components.data: Purify double-stranded PCR products and concentrate by ethanol precipitation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Purify double-stranded PCR products and concentrate by ethanol precipitation.

components.data: Examine on 1% agarose gels and directly sequence in both directions using the same primers as those used for amplification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Examine on 1% agarose gels and directly sequence in both directions using the same primers as those used for amplification.

components.data: Conduct sequencing using an ABI PRISM 3130 XL automated sequencer (Applied Biosystems™) at the Sequencing Services of Universidad de Buenos Aires (Buenos Aires, Argentina).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Conduct sequencing using an ABI PRISM 3130 XL automated sequencer (Applied Biosystems™) at the Sequencing Services of Universidad de Buenos Aires (Buenos Aires, Argentina).

components.data: Edit sequences with Chromas 2.3 (Technelysium Pty. Ltd., 1998–2004, http://www.technelysium.com.au) and align using the computer software package CLUSTAL W (Thompson et al., 1994).
components.name: Description
